keyTakeAways: The San Jose Sharks apologized for displaying a message that appeared to praise Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), which is widely seen as controversial and offensive, especially in the context of a Hispanic Heritage Night celebration.

The message — 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !' — was displayed during a game against the Pittsburgh Penguins at SAP Center in San Jose, California, and reportedly caused backlash from fans, including one fan who said she was 'appalled'.

The team confirmed the message was externally submitted and was inadvertently displayed during the first intermission, despite not reflecting the organization’s values or being caught during standard review processes.
The Sharks are investigating the origin of the message and have expressed deep regret over the incident.

The event, 'Los Tiburones Night,' is an annual celebration of the team’s commitment to the Bay Area’s vibrant Hispanic community, highlighting cultural inclusion, but this incident damaged public trust in that commitment.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The San Jose Sharks apologized after an offensive message praising Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) was displayed during their Hispanic Heritage Night celebration against the Pittsburgh Penguins at SAP Center. The message, 'SJ SHARKS FANS LOVE ICE !! GET ‘EM BOYZ !', sparked outrage from fans, including Jessica Clark, who called it appallingly inappropriate. The team stated the message was externally submitted, inadvertently displayed, and did not reflect their values or go through standard review processes. The incident occurred during 'Los Tiburones Night,' an annual event celebrating the team’s connection to the Bay Area’s Hispanic community, and has raised concerns about cultural sensitivity in public events. The Sharks are investigating the origin of the message and expressing deep regret.
title: San Jose Sharks Apologize for 'Offensively Wording Message' Displayed During Hispanic Heritage Night
